div.p: I’ve got a daughter who’s quite young so I started off part-time which was nice so I'd sort of come in half the week and have half the week
with my daughter while she was quite young which was really good and they’re really supportive of the fact that I had a daughter
in regards to coming in and taking time off if I needed to to take my daughter somewhere or being a bit later because I’m taking her to nursery
so that’s really good. And recently I’ve started full-time now so it was nice to be able to sort of start gradually and build up sort of working
full-time obviously starting part-time and then being able to sort of learn everything and build up to being full-time and now she’s older
she’s at nursery so it’s a good sort of work-life balance I think really.
